pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.4: This non-offense clause is noteworthy in that it seems to contradict the “or” structure of the rule. The rule suggests that there is an offense if any of the five sub-clauses are fulfilled, whereas this non-offense clause says that there is no offense if the last clause is not fulfilled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.6: Sp 5.467: _Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno_, “_Aññavihita_: thinking of something else.”
